title: RUSTFLAGS="-Z sanitizer=thread" M1 macbook could not compile because of SIGSEGV

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried to compile 'memchr' library with thread sanitizer in M1 macbook with this code:

```
git clone https://github.com/BurntSushi/memchr
cd memchr
RUSTFLAGS="-Z sanitizer=thread" \
        TSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=suppress_tsan.txt" \
        RUSTDOCFLAGS="-Z sanitizer=thread" \
        RUST_TEST_THREADS=1 \
        cargo +nightly build
```
I expected to see this happen: compile success.
But this fails with below error(SIGSEGV)
```
Compiling memchr v2.4.1 (/Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr)
error: could not compile `memchr`

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name build_script_build --edition=2018 build.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 --cfg 'feature="default"' --cfg 'feature="std"' -C metadata=d38bef7e99949849 -C extra-filename=-d38bef7e99949849 --out-dir /Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/build/memchr-d38bef7e99949849 -C incremental=/Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/deps -Z sanitizer=thread` (signal: 11, SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference)
```
Except SIGSEGV error, I couldn't get more information about this error.

Also, with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 like this command doesn't give any further information.
```
RUSTFLAGS="-Z sanitizer=thread" \
        TSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=suppress_tsan.txt" \
        RUSTDOCFLAGS="-Z sanitizer=thread" \
        RUST_TEST_THREADS=1 RUST_BACKTRACE=1\
        cargo +nightly build
```

To dig more, I used lldb with this command
```
lldb -- rustc +nightly --crate-name build_script_build --edition=2018 build.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 --cfg 'feature="default"' --cfg 'feature="std"' -C metadata=d38bef7e99949849 -C extra-filename=-d38bef7e99949849 --out-dir /Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/build/memchr-d38bef7e99949849 -C incremental=/Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/Users/junsoolee/Documents/cs431/homework/memchr/target/debug/deps -Z sanitizer=thread
```
And now I have EXC_BAD_ACCESS on lldb with this error.
```
Process 78462 stopped
* thread #10, name = 'opt 3rag1o5gdrnc88eh', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x0)
    frame #0: 0x00000001018d9700 librustc_driver-a137162e5cae908e.dylib`(anonymous namespace)::RegAllocFast::allocVirtReg(llvm::MachineInstr&, (anonymous namespace)::RegAllocFast::LiveReg&, llvm::Register, bool) + 156
librustc_driver-a137162e5cae908e.dylib`(anonymous namespace)::RegAllocFast::allocVirtReg:
->  0x1018d9700 <+156>: ldr    x8, [x24]
    0x1018d9704 <+160>: mov    w9, w23
    0x1018d9708 <+164>: lsr    x9, x9, #3
    0x1018d970c <+168>: ldrh   w10, [x8, #0x16]
Target 0: (rustc) stopped. 
```

So, what should i do to dig this error more deeply?
Thank you for your time.
